clinical_study.brief_title: Preoperative Anxiety and Relaxation: Effects on the Autonomous Nervous System
clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative Anxiety and Relaxation: Effects on the Autonomous Nervous System

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
Anxiety is an emotional disorder. It's a painful concern caused by uncertainty. It is a complex phenomenon misunderstood in spite of medical progress. Relaxation is a technical for reduce anxiety and is effective and safe. Previous study demonstrated the impact of session relaxation on the autonomous nervous system by the heart rate variability.
Primary objective of this new study is to demonstrate a link between heart rate variability and reduced anxiety during relaxation session.

detailed_description.textblock: It is monocentric, prospective and interventional study. This study will be proposed at the patients who will have an orthopedic surgery in full hospitalization. These patients are anxious because of surgery too. The day before surgery anesthetist save heart rate variability and value of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide during relaxation session.

primary_outcome.description: from the variation of heart rate. Measured by electrocardiogram.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after the relaxation session at day 1
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI-Y) Interpretation : Very high:> to 65 High: from 56 to 65 Average: from 46 to 55 Low: from 36 to 45 Very low: <or = 35

secondary_outcome.measure: the ratio of high frequencies to low frequencies

secondary_outcome.description: measured with a sensor fixed in front of the nostril

arm_group.description: Patients anxious will be perform relaxation session.

intervention.description: During relaxation session, patients anxious will have three electrodes for save heart rate variability and a sensor for save value of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide. Before and after relaxation session, patient evaluates his anxiety by visual analogue scale (VAS) and State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI-Y).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Affiliated or entitled to a social security
- Have signed consent before their participation in the study
- Aged over 18 years
- Patients who will have an orthopedic surgery in full hospitalization
- Patients anxious on visual analogic scale of anxiety (>5)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Different disorder : disability to understand instructions, respiratory insufficiency, obesity, sleep apnea, wearing a pacemaker
- Medical history of schizophrenia or bipolar disorder
